personalInfo.splInterest: Reading, movies and spending time with his family

tourBios.intlVics: Over 30 wins, including: 2009 XLIX Abierto Internacional de Golf Copa SURA [TLA], 2010 Campeonato Nacional de Profesionales [Colombia], 60º Abierto del Club Manizales [Colombia], 51º Sport Francés Open [TLA], 2011 66º Abierto de Granadilla [Chile], 2013 Abierto del Country Barranquilla [Colombia], Abierto de Ibagué [Colombia], XIV Abierto de Golf de Serrezuela [Colombia], 2014 Abierto del Club La Cima [Colombia], Abierto Cafetero de Golf [Colombia], XVI Abierto del Club El Rancho [Colombia]
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Earned full status on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica by finishing inside the top-5 at the 2014 Developmental Series Grand Final at Arrayanes CC in Quito, Ecuador in January... Had one top-10, four top-25s and six cuts made in 15 starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, where he finished the year ranked 70th on the Order of Merit... Best finish was T5 at the 57th Abierto Mexicano in May. Carded a third round of 9-under 63 to take the outright lead by one at Aguascalientes CC, but closed with a 72 to finish four strokes behind the champion. Has his wife, Paulina, caddieing for him that week.

2014: Finished T4 at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season opening 67th Arturo Calle Colombian Open at Ruitoque Golf CC in the city of Bucaramanga. That was his only top-25 in eight starts in which he made three cuts to finish No. 96 on the Order of Merit… Finished T14 at the rain-shortened Colombia Championship on the Web.com Tour in February. On his other Web.com Tour start he missed the cut at the Chile Classic… Had a trio of victories on the Colombian Tour. Won the Abierto del Club La Cima by 13 shots in April, finishing at 265 (-15), the Abierto Cafetero de Golf by one at 263 (-17) in June and the XVI Abierto del Club El Rancho by four shots at 274 (-14) in August.

2013: Finished the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 41 in the Order of Merit. Had two top-5 finishes in the two events played in Colombia and made the cut in four of his five starts. His best finish was T3 at the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic in November, a tournament he closed with a round of 7-under par 65 to finish two strokes behind. Finished T4 at the 66th Arturo Calle Colombian Open in May. Had another strong closing round of 6-under par 65… Finished the Colombian Tour season as the No. 1 ranked player with a trio of victories at the Abierto del Country Barranquilla, the Abierto de Ibague and the XIV Abierto de Golf de Serrezuela.

2012: Despite having full status, he only made three starts during the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. Finished the year ranked No. 19 in the Order of Merit with top-10 finishes in his three starts. Playing at the Club Campestre de Cali, his home course, he went on to lose a playoff for the title of the Arturo Calle Colombian Coffee Classic in November. Carded a 69 on the final round to finish in a two-way tie with Sebastián Fernández at 275 (-9). Fernández made a 15-footer for birdie and the win on the first playoff hole. His other top-10 finishes were T9 at the Lexus Peru Open and T10 at the 65th Arturo Calle Colombian Open… In his only Web.com Tour start of the season he missed the cut at the Pacific Rubiales Colombia Championship.

2011: Finished the Tour de las Americas season ranked No. 18 in the Order of Merit. Had top-15 finishes in four of his six TLA starts. His best TLA finish was runner-up at the 53rd Abierto Ciudad de Bucaramanga in Colombia, a tournament he lost in a playoff against his countryman Álvaro Arizabaleta in July. A week later he finishes fourth at the 51st Abierto Internacional de Golf Copa Sura in Medellin, Colombia… Made the cut in two of his three starts on the Web.com Tour, with a T30 finish at the Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open and a T58 finish at the Mexico Open… Won the Chilean Tour's 66th Abierto de Granadilla in Viña del Mar, Chile. Finished at 279 (-9) to defeat Chile's Benjamín Alvarado by two strokes.

2010: Finished the Tour de las Americas season ranked No. 4 in the Order of Merit. Had three top-5 finishes and nine top-15 finishes in 11 TLA starts. Claimed his second TLA career win at the 51st Sport Francés Open in Santiago, Chile. Posted scores of 68, 69, 65 and 69 to win by four strokes at 271 (-17). A week later he went on to finish T3 at the 84th Abierto de Chile Copa BCI. Also finished fourth at the VI Abierto Internacional de Golf Eje Cafetero in Colombia in July.

2009: Holed out for birdie to win a sudden death playoff for his first Tour de las Americas title at the 49th Abierto Internacional de Golf Copa SURA in Medellin, Colombia in June. Forced the playoff with his countryman and 54-hole leader Edgar Gómez with a final round of 71 to finish in a two-way tie at 280 (-8). Two weeks earlier he had a runner-up finish at the 51st Abierto Internacional Ciudad de Bucaramanga in Colombia. Had four top-15 finishes in five starts on the TLA.

OTHER DETAILS: Has won over 30 tournaments as a professional, most of those wins on the Colombian Tour… Won two minitour events in the United States.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: A golf team member at Brigham Young University (BYU), where he was a freshman in 1996… Won the South American Junior Championship twice… Won Colombian National Championships as ages 12 and 15.
tourBios.personal: His instructor is Alberto Evers… Studied philosophy and psychology at Brigham Young University… Got started in golf at the age of 6 at the Club Campestre de Cali. Was playing tennis at first, but switched to golf and became the first golfer within his family… Has an older brother, Andrés, who is an amateur golfer, and a younger sister, Miranda.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was 2nd in 2012 at the Arturo Calle Colombian Coffee Classic presented by Avianca.
